pr_title: Historical unloads damaged segments automatically when lazy on start.

timeline.bodyText: Use a more meaningful name, like SegmentLazyLoadFailCallback

replies.bodyText: I think a meaningful name is better for code readiness through the method arguments
replies.author: kaijianding

replies.bodyText:
I don't feel super strongly about this, while I find it pretty obvious what Runnable does and don't think a new interface adds much here, I can see your point as well.
I would agree that if we insist on using a separate interface that it should have a better name more indicative of its function.
replies.author: clintropolis

replies.bodyText: Change the name to SegmentLazyLoadFailCallback as you guys suggested. Thanks for review :)
replies.author: zhangyue19921010

timeline.bodyText: add a new @param in the method comment
timeline.author: kaijianding
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -219,9 +220,9 @@ private TableDataSource getTableDataSource(DataSourceAnalysis analysis)
    *
    * @throws SegmentLoadingException if the segment cannot be loaded
    */
-  public boolean loadSegment(final DataSegment segment, boolean lazy) throws SegmentLoadingException
+  public boolean loadSegment(final DataSegment segment, boolean lazy, CommonCallback loadFailed) throws SegmentLoadingException

timeline.message: changing the package of SegmentLazyLoadFailCallback.java to org.apache.druid.segment

timeline.author: clintropolis

replies.bodyText: Current UTs don't cover load segment in a lazy way. This PR add a UT to test lazy loading which needs extra memory.
replies.author: zhangyue19921010

replies.bodyText: 👍 was just surprised how much more it needed, if travis passes then I assume the change is fine, was just curious mostly
replies.author: clintropolis
